Recap: Blair is distraught after Eli has been burned in the fire and for not seeing him for who he really is. She goes to the Tahiti police station with John and gets ready to return to her family. Back in Llanview, Todd and Dani are feeling the same way over the loss of Tea. Starr is also mourning her since they were close but encourages her father to celebrate Tea's life. She also realizes that Todd had no clue that Blair has married a killer. When he finds out that Eli pushed Marty and got both Hannah and himself wrongfully accused, he is angry. He feels guilty for encouraging Blair to marry him for and for not finding Tea until it was too late. Brody finds out that Jessica asked Dr. Vivian to do an Rh test which she does not need if he's the father of her baby. Natalie is similarly concerned that it's possible that Brody is the father of her baby. Meanwhile, Robert Ford tries and fails to win Langston over and apologizes for how he has treated her. She sounds like she will never trust or believe a word he says.
Transcript: Langston: What am I doing?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dr. Wright: Sharon, could you put a note in Jessica Brennan's file? She needs treatment to prevent Rh disease in her baby.
Brody: No, she doesn't.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Rex: Did you get the classes you wanted?

Gigi: All of them except, of course, how to pay for college 101. I mean, even with the financial aid and the loans, I just don't know how I'm gonna make it. I owe over $500 alone just for books, and--yes, okay--I am applying for this life experience grant, but if you subtract all the hours I'm gonna be missing here and add in all the extra babysitters and gas and takeout, because you know I'm not gonna have time to boil water--
Rex: Well, fret no more, my little freshwoman.
Gigi: Oh, my...God, is that--
Rex: Real? You betcha. It's my payday for helping Kelly. Your problems are solved.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jessica: Hey, Kelly.
Kelly: Hey, I came over as soon as I could. Thanks for letting me know about Téa. I saw your mom's car outside.
Jessica: She's upstairs with Dani.
Kelly: How's she doing?
Jessica: Not good.
Kelly: You know, dealing with my mother's death was hard enough, and I'm an adult, you know--or at least that's the rumor--but losing a mother at Dani's age--
Jessica: I know.
Kelly: How's Todd doing?
Jessica: Terrible, but he's with Starr.
Kelly: Good. He'll listen to her.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Starr: Dad, we need to talk about Mom because she--
Todd: I don't want to hear it right now.
Starr: Dad--
Todd: No. Téa begged Blair to be here for Dani. She practically wrote her a book--"Everything you wanted to know about Dani but were afraid to ask"--and where is she?
Starr: Will you listen to me for a second?
Todd: Don't defend her to me. She promised she'd be here, and just when Dani needs her support the most, what does she do? She runs off with Eli Clarke.
Starr: Would you just listen? She would be here if she could, Dad.
Todd: She's exactly where she wants to be. She's trumping Téa by running off with the man of her dreams.
Starr: Mom is lucky to be alive. Eli Clarke is a killer.
[SCENE_BREAK]
John: Hey, I'm sorry I haven't been able to call until now.
Natalie: You okay?
John: Yeah.
Natalie: You gonna bring that son of a bitch Clarke home so he can stand trial?
John: Yeah. I don't think that's gonna happen.
Natalie: Why? Is he dead?
John: I'm waiting for confirmation.
Natalie: How's Blair?
John: She survived Clarke and the fire that probably killed him, but, no, she's not okay.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Kelly: How are you? I've been so wrapped up in this investigation, I haven't called you at all. You and the baby okay?
Jessica: Fine. We're fine, except I'm no closer to knowing whether the father is the love of my life or the biggest mistake I've ever made.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Langston: I can't do this.
Ford: You're right. That was dumb. You're a student. I'm a teacher. We can't kiss here. Let's go back to my place.
Langston: No. I can't kiss you anywhere.
Ford: Okay, so drop out of my class, and then I will--
Langston: I'm supposed to change my major so you can kiss me? Do you even hear yourself?
Ford: That's not what I meant. I just meant that if you want to be together, then--
Langston: Whoa, whoa. Who said that? I mean, yeah, we have history, but it's taught me that you're very bad for me.
Ford: Langston, I'm not the same person anymore. A lot has happened. I know what's important--you. I can't even stop thinking about you.
Langston: Because you can't have me. That's all this is.
Ford: That's not true. I know I've treated you really badly in the past, but if you just give me a chance, I promise I can make it up to you.
Langston: You can't.
Ford: No. Just give me one more chance.
Langston: No! I don't trust you, and I never will.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Kelly: Okay. I know that you don't want to disappoint Brody and you don't want to have to hand off the kid to Ford every other weekend.
Jessica: Trust me, he is not interested in that, not even part-time. That's not my problem. It's this Rh thing. It's what my daughter died of-- Chloe. Every child I have is at risk for it.
Kelly: Well, don't they have treatments for that now?
Jessica: Yeah, but it depends on the father. If the father's Rh is incompatible, then I need to get a shot of gamma globulin.
Kelly: Has Brody been tested?
Jessica: Brody is compatible.
Kelly: So that's good, isn't it?
Jessica: Oh, yeah. It would be great if Ford were compatible, but he isn't.
Kelly: So you have to get the shot whether you need it or not.
Jessica: And if Brody finds out that I get the shot--
Kelly: He'll know you've been lying to him.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dr. Wright: I'm sorry. Who are you?
Brody: Brody Lovett-- Jessica's fiancé, the father of her baby.
Dr. Wright: Oh.
Brody: I was here on a case, and I thought I'd stop by and introduce myself.
Dr. Wright: Well, it's nice to meet you, Officer Lovett.
Brody: So you were saying something about Jessica needing treatment for Rh, and I'm sure I got it wrong. I'm pretty new to this, but why would you think Jessica needs treatment when she doesn't?
Nurse: Oh, I bet you're doing what I did the other day, Dr. Wright, confusing Jessica with her sister Natalie.
Dr. Wright: Heh. Sure.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Natalie: So when can you come home?
John: I'm not sure. I'm waiting on the locals. I want to interview Rayburn. I want to I.D. the body, confirm that Clarke is dead.
Natalie: You bringing Blair home?
John: Yeah. Hey, look. In case we get delayed, I was wondering if maybe you could push back that appointment with the doc tomorrow. I want to be there. She's showing you the sonogram, right?
Natalie: Uh, yeah. That's the plan.
John: You know, I remember when Mike first saw that sonogram of Gabriel. He was passing out copies for weeks. Hey, you okay?
Natalie: Uh, yeah. Yeah. I'm fine. You know, I'm just having a little bit of a hard time hearing you.
John: All right. Well, look. Just see if you can get another appointment tomorrow, a later one. I could use something to look forward to.
Natalie: Absolutely. I'll take care of it.
John: You take care of yourself, okay?
Natalie: You, too.
John: Natalie?
Natalie: Yeah?
John: It's nice to have something good to think about.
Natalie: I know. [Sighs]
John: [Sighs] They got Rayburn in lockup.

Blair: Oh, Eli blamed all of it on Ross, tried to get me to buy into it. Of course, I did. Why not? I bought everything because I trusted him. Yeah. How could I have fallen in love with a man who would kill such an innocent woman like my Aunt Melinda? How could I have been so blind?
John: That's not true. You weren't blind. Hey, you know something? You-- you got a whole world of people out there that love you.
[Blair sniffles]
[SCENE_BREAK]
Starr: Hannah O'Connor didn't push Marty. Eli did.
Todd: Clarke?
Starr: Yeah.
Todd: Ohh... she named me. Cole put me in the hospital. McBain put me in jail because this girl named me.
Starr: Dad, Mom is in danger! Does that mean anything to you right now?

Todd: Yeah, of course, but, you know, your mom is tough. If she survived me, she can survive anything, and, you know, I got to apologize but, you know, all that time laid up, you know, in the hospital, in jail, I could've been with Téa and-- [Exhales]
Starr: Hey, I'm really sorry, Dad.
Todd: Yeah.
[Cell phone rings]
Starr: Hello?
John: Hey. Hey, Starr, it's John McBain. Hey, listen. I'm not sure how much you know.
Starr: I know that my mom eloped with a serial killer.
Todd: Who is that?
Starr: Is she okay? It's John McBain. Shh.
John: She's not hurt. She's a little shaken up. I'm gonna put you on with her now, okay? Hey, it's Starr. She wants to hear your voice.
Blair: Thank you. Hey, baby.
Starr: Mom, are you okay?
Blair: Yeah. I'm good. I'm fine.
Starr: I was so scared.
Blair: Me, too. Me, too.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Kelly: So what if this baby is really Brody's and you take this shot?
Jessica: Oh, no. It's fine. It's safe. That's not the problem. The problem is, I've already talked to Brody about it. How am I gonna explain it if he finds out I get the shot?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Brody: Jessica doesn't need a shot. My Rh factor matches hers. The baby won't be in any danger.
Dr. Wright: So you've been tested.
Brody: In the service, I had a full work-up.
Dr. Wright: Oh, well, that's great then. I guess Jessica wasn't aware that you had--
Brody: No. Yeah. She was. I told her. Maybe that was after she talked to you.
Dr. Wright: Um, in any event, I'll make a note.
Brody: If you have a minute, Dr. Wright, I just got a few more questions about the baby.
Dr. Wright: Of course. What is it you want to know?
[SCENE_BREAK]

Ford: I know I've given you plenty of reasons not to trust me, and I'm really trying to change that. The last couple of months with my brother showing up and then my mom and thinking about how I let him down the way she did-- it used to just be me, you know? I did what I had to do to survive, but now I've got a family, and I have to be better.
Langston: I've watched you step up with your brother, and I know that Eli Clarke didn't give you much of a choice, so, yeah, I can see you're making an effort, but it's just not--
Ford: Langston, Langston, I almost died. When I woke up in the hospital, I knew things couldn't go back to the way they were before, and then with my family coming back, I have to change.
Langston: Well, good luck with that.
Ford: Don't you understand me?

Langston: Ford, it all sounds great, but somewhere between your near-death experience, your family showing up, your weeks in the hospital, you still managed to have sex with someone who could've given you an STD.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Brody: What are the chances of the baby contracting Jessica's hepatitis C?

Dr. Wright: Statistics vary, but luckily, Jessica's viral levels are very low. As long as she stays healthy, the baby has an excellent chance of not contracting the disease, but you know what? I'll take every precaution.
Brody: Does she have to have a C-section?
Dr. Wright: I'll have to discuss the options with Jessica.
Brody: We'll all talk about it next time she comes in.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jessica: So I'm relying on my doctor's discretion.

Jessica: Well, that's the plan. Yeah.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Brody: I plan on being at all her appointments from now on.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jessica: I just hate lying to Brody, you know, but how can I tell him that this could be Ford's baby, and why break his heart when I might not have to?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Brody: Jessica told me you're gonna do a sonogram tomorrow. I can't wait.
Dr. Wright: Those are always very exciting. So I'll see you tomorrow?
Brody: Thank you for taking the time to talk to me. I'm sorry. I don't mean to be pushy. It's just, it's really important to me, becoming a father.

Starr: Oh, my God, you married him?

Blair: Yes. I did, and not an hour later, I found out who he really was. Kelly called, told me everything, and this time, I heard it. I confronted him, and he tried to convince me that we actually belonged together. There was a little bit of a struggle, and I shot him.

Blair: Yeah. I shot him.
Starr: Is he dead?
Blair: Well, if the bullet didn't kill him, the fire certainly did.
Starr: Mom, when can you get out of there?
Blair: How's Dani? Is she doing all right? Because I promised Téa that I would look after her. I've been so worried.
Starr: Don't worry about it, Mom. Just get home as soon as you can, and we'll all be waiting for you.
Blair: All right.
Starr: And, Mom...I love you.
Blair: I love you, too.

Starr: I couldn't. She was a mess.

John: You okay?
Blair: Yeah.

Blair: Thank you for getting Starr on the phone. It was good to be reminded of what's important.

Blair: John, Eli told me... while you were investigating Aunt Melinda's death that he needed to distract you. He's the one that pushed Marty down the stairs.

Ford: Langston, are you gonna keep beating me up, or are you gonna listen to me? I'm really sorry about what I've done to you. Losing you, I haven't been able to get over it because you're the one. Jessica: You busted into Eli Clarke's hotel room? You could've been killed.

Rex: Hey, I am more then my good looks, Morasco, and I would think you, a beautiful woman trying to make it in the working world, would appreciate that.

Rex: Well, it was-- you had left. She came back.

Gigi: Don't tell me she walked in on you again.

Gigi: True, but L.U. is a really big place. I mean, I did see Robert Ford at registration.
Rex: He's every woman's dream. Is he still hitting on you?
Gigi: Not yet, but I could stop by the office and see if he wants to help me with my homework. After all, he is my type.

Gigi: Well, he's a bad boy like you.

Gigi: True.
Rex: Hey, you know, if you want to hop on that train--

Langston: You bring out the worst in me, Ford, and I can't go back there. I won't.

Jessica: You okay?

Kelly: Yeah. I'm just stunned. That's all. I'm so sorry. I'm sorry about Blair, and I'm also sorry about Téa. I know how much you loved her and you, too. I know that you were close when you were little, and she was like a second mother to you.
Starr: I still can't believe it.
Kelly: I know. It's a lot to take in. Is there anything I can do for you at all?
Todd: Why don't you wipe tomorrow's headline and go with "the scum is dead"?
Kelly: You got it.
Todd: All right. Go.
Kelly: I think I'm gonna head out.
Jessica: Kelly, I'm so sorry you didn't get to unload on Eli.
Kelly: Hey, that's what front pages are for, you know? I'm just worried about the baby, about you and the baby.
Jessica: Nothing I can do about it right now.
Kelly: Okay. All right.
Jessica: Okay.

Brody: That was awkward.
Natalie: Tell me about it.

Natalie: Yeah? Well, I just had to lie to John on the phone.
Brody: Is he still in Tahiti with Clarke?
Natalie: Yeah. They're waiting on confirmation that Clarke is dead, so hopefully, case closed.
Brody: That's some good news. Wish we had some.
Natalie: The bottom line is, you're having a baby with Jess, and that is what you have to focus on, okay? This baby is John's.
Brody: And if it isn't?
Natalie: Brody, we've talked about this. This baby is John's, no matter what. You've got to let this go, please, for all of us.
Brody: I'll let it go...for now.
[Natalie sighs]

John: I'm sorry you had to see that.
Blair: I wanted to see it. God, his face was burned so badly, it could've been anybody.

Langston: Look. I know this isn't easy, putting yourself out there like this, and maybe I even believe you that you're ready to put the walls down and be a whole new person, but now I've got walls of my own.

Langston: Well, wait all you want, but I'm not dropping your class.

Blair: Why didn't I see it?

Todd: You upset about your mom?

Todd: It's my fault, though. I didn't like Clarke, never, from the beginning. I didn't tell your mom. You know, I didn't want to rain on her parade. I was happy. You know, she asked my opinion about him, and I told her to go for it.

Blair: I was afraid to get close to him because of Todd. He told me that I was the first woman that he ever wanted to even marry. He won me over with a lie.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Todd: And I cheered her on over him because I didn't want to appear...controlling or jealous, stingy, and then she could've died because of me.

Blair: He'd already been married twice. First wife, he killed. Second one disappeared. Oh, God only knows what he would've done to me.
John: You know he can't hurt you anymore.
Blair: John, I'm worried about me. Here, I thought I was marrying somebody who was so, so not like Todd. He was worse than Todd could ever be...ever.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Todd: Maybe I'm losing my touch.
Starr: Hey, no. No, you're not. Listen.
Todd: I didn't like Clarke, not from the beginning, man. He's just so, uh, perfect and everything, but a psycho? Man, I missed it.
Starr: You're not a trained psychiatrist or something, okay? Give yourself a break.
Todd: I can't. I can't. He snowed me. And then there's Téa, who kept telling me she was dying, and I just refused to believe her.

Blair: I didn't believe Kelly when she kept warning me about him. I didn't believe my own son. He kept calling Eli a murderer, and I just laughed at him.
John: Yeah. Well, that Jack is a funny kid.
Blair: Yeah. He is, but he was right. So were you. Oh, I'm so sorry, John. You tried to warn me, and I didn't listen. I'm really sorry.

Blair: There are a lot of things to be sorry about. I fell in love with a man who killed your baby. How could I have been so blind? [Sobs]

Natalie: John is waiting on the body, and he's bringing Blair home.

Natalie: Um, having my first sonogram tomorrow, and John is coming.
Gigi: And?
Natalie: And, you know, he's really good at what he does, and I just keep thinking that he is going to-- he's gonna figure it out.
Gigi: Okay. John is good, but do you think he's so good that he'll really guess that the baby isn't his and that it could be Brody's? I mean, that's kind of a leap, don't you think?
Natalie: God, I hope so.

Jessica: Hey.
Brody: How are you doing?
Jessica: Um, okay.
Brody: Yeah?
Jessica: Yeah. I'm just pregnant, but I've been there before.
Brody: Well, I haven't, and it's a really big deal for me, and--
Jessica: Oh, of course. It is for me, too. I didn't mean to say that it wasn't. I just have a lot on my mind.
Brody: How is everyone?
Jessica: Not good.

Todd: I let Téa leave thinking that son of a bitch guy could follow her. Son of a bitch just loses her, and then I finally strong-arm Shaun into telling me where she is, and I take Dani down there for nothing. It's too late.
Starr: There's still a way to say good-bye, Dad... and now I know how.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jessica: I'm just waiting for my mother. She's upstairs with Dani.

Nurse: Dr. Wright, question. I didn't want to interrupt you when you were talking to Jessica Brennan's boyfriend, but does she need that Rh shot or not?

Dr. Wright: Uh...
Nurse: Oh.
Dr. Wright: Yeah.

Ford: So does that mean you're gonna take my class? We're gonna see each other a couple times a week?
Langston: Yes, but if you make another pass at me, I'll bring you up on sexual harassment charges, and you'll lose your job.

Langston: Like it matters, anyway. You'll be on to the next one soon enough, and all this will be just a waste of time. I'll see you later, Professor.
Ford: Wait. Don't walk away from me. Langston! Langston!

Jessica: Uh, Dr. Wright was just being careful, you know? She knows how hard it was for me to lose Chloe.

Natalie: You're right. I mean, John is really good at what he does, but he's not a mind reader, so there's no way he could figure out from a sonogram that this baby might not be his, right?
Gigi: Right, because all you'll get is this blurry image of the baby's shape and, if you're lucky, the heart beating at the right angle.
Natalie: Okay. Okay. You know what? Everything is gonna be fine.

Rex: You're right. It won't bring her back, but it would've felt damn good.

Kelly: Yeah. I knew you'd understand, but now he's gone, you know? He doesn't have to answer to anything, you know? I don't know. After all that work we did --tracking him down, piecing it together--it's like he took the easy way out, you know? My mom had to die all alone... for no good reason at all.

John: Okay, and I want a complete transcript of Rayburn's interrogation.
Cop: Not a problem.
John: Okay, and keep him in custody until we straighten out extradition.
Cop: I think we can slow things down if necessary.
John: Good. Tell the M.E. I want proof positive--that's DNA, dental records, the whole 9 yards--on Clarke's body. Thanks.
John: [Sighs] You ready?
[SCENE_BREAK]

Starr: Whenever you're ready, I think that we should have a memorial for Téa, right? We can have it at St. James. We can get together all the music that she loves and the photos of her and get together the people that she cared about, make it really special.
Todd: The...ashes. I don't have them.

Starr: Téa is not her ashes, Dad, and I think it's really important for you and Dani to start thinking about all of the great things because you can't change how she died, right? So we could get together photos and think of all the great Téa stories that we have and--
Todd: Oh, no. No. I hate that. You know, everyone gets up there and pretend it's all okay just because something funny happened once. You know, that's a crap. That's-- [Scoffs]
Starr: You're afraid that you're gonna cry, aren't you?
Todd: No.

Starr: Dad, it's okay. I'm going to do this memorial, okay, because I believe that that is what Dani needs, okay? She needs to know that her mother was respected and loved and that she has people that care about her, okay? She needs a time and a place to say good-bye.
Todd: Mm. Uh, fine. You do that. You do the memorial.
Starr: All right.
Todd: All right. Ahem.
Starr: Are you okay?
Todd: Oh... [Scoffs] I got that over there. Ha ha! Don't forget your purse. Good night.
[SCENE_BREAK]
John: Come on. I'll buy you a drink.
Blair: Okay.
